panels.description: This shows how many members are configured in the replica set.
panels.title: ReplSet Members

panels.description: This shows the time since the last election.
panels.title: ReplSet Last Election

panels.description: This panel shows how far behind in replication this member is if it is a secondary. This number may be high it the instance is running as a delayed secondary member.
panels.title: Avg ReplSet Lag

panels.description: ReplSet statuses during the select time range.
panels.title: ReplSet States

panels.description: MongoDB replication lag occurs when the secondary node cannot replicate data fast enough to keep up with the rate that data is being written to the primary node. It could be caused by something as simple as network latency, packet loss within your network, or a routing issue.
panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description: Operations are classified by legacy wire protocol type (insert, update, and delete only).
panels.title: Operations - $instance

panels.description: This metric can show a correlation with the replication lag value.

targets.expr:
avg by (instance,name,state) (mongodb_mongod_replset_member_ping_ms{instance=~"$instance"})
* on (name) group_right(state) avg by (instance,state,name) ((max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name[$interval]) or max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name[5m])))

panels.title: Max Member Ping Time - $instance

panels.description: Time span between now and last heartbeat from replicaset members.

targets.expr: time() - avg by (instance) (max(mongodb_mongod_replset_member_last_heartbeat{instance=~"$instance"}) by (name)) * on (name) group_right avg by (instance) (mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{instance=~"$instance"})
avg by (instance) (max(mongodb_rs_heartbeatIntervalMillis{instance=~"$instance"}) by (name) / 1000) * on (name) group_right avg by (instance) (mongodb_mongod_replset_my_name{instance=~"$instance"})

panels.title: Max Heartbeat Time

panels.description: Count of elections. Usually zero; 1 count by each healthy node will appear in each election. Happens when the primary role changes due to either normal maintenance or trouble events.
panels.title: Elections

panels.description: Timespan 'window' between newest and the oldest op in the Oplog collection.
panels.title: Oplog Recovery Window - $instance

panels.description: Repl buffer ops applied per sec.
panels.title: Oplog Buffered Operations

panels.description: Time spent per second waiting for or fetching oplog docs in replication.
panels.title: Oplog Getmore Time

panels.description: Times spent per second A) pre-loading oplog ops into parallel-executable batches B) Times spent pre-loading index values and C) repl batch apply phase.
panels.title: Oplog Processing Time - $instance

panels.description: Current hard-coded max and actual size of repl batch buffer.
panels.title: Oplog Buffer Capacity - $instance

panels.description: Count of A) getmores executed B) index values pre-loaded C) oplog docs applied per second against oplog collection in replication.
panels.title: Oplog Operations - $instance

patterns.name: Uptime
patterns.tooltipTemplate: The parameter shows how long a service has been “up” and running without a shut down or restart.

patterns.name: Open Connections
patterns.tooltipTemplate: Connects to a MongoDB instance and to a specified database on that instance.

patterns.name: Cursors
patterns.tooltipTemplate: When the db. collection. find () function is used to search for documents in the collection, the result returns a pointer to the collection of documents returned which is called a cursor.

targets.expr:
avg by (instance) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{instance=~"$instance", state="current"}[$interval]) or 
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_connections{instance=~"$instance", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{instance=~"$instance", state="current"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_connections{instance=~"$instance", state="current"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{instance=~"$instance", state="current"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_connections{instance=~"$instance", state="current"}[5m]))

avg by (instance) (max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_metrics_cursor_open{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_cursors{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongod_cursors{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[$interval]) or 
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_metrics_cursor_open{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[5m]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_cursors{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[$interval]) or
max_over_time(mongodb_mongos_cursors{instance=~"$instance",state="total"}[5m]))

panels.description: Average latency of operations (classified by read, write, or (other) command).
panels.title: Latency Detail - $instance

panels.description: Docs per second inserted, updated, deleted or returned. (N.b. not 1-to-1 with operation counts.)
panels.title: Document Operations - $instance

panels.description: MongoDB keeps most recently used data in RAM. If you have created indexes for your queries and your working data set fits in RAM, MongoDB serves all queries from memory.
panels.title: Cache - $instance

patterns.name: Uptime
patterns.tooltipTemplate: The parameter shows how long a system has been “up” and running without a shut down or restart.

patterns.name: Load
patterns.tooltipTemplate: The system load is a measurement of the computational work the system is performing. Each running process either using or waiting for CPU resources adds 1 to the load.

patterns.name: Memory
patterns.tooltipTemplate: The parameter shows how long a system has been “up” and running without a shut down or restart.

patterns.name: RAM
patterns.tooltipTemplate: RAM (Random Access Memory) is the hardware in a computing device where the operating system, application programs and data in current use are kept so they can be quickly reached by the device's processor.

patterns.name: Disk Space
patterns.tooltipTemplate: Sum of disk space on all partitions. Note  it can be significantly over-reported in some installations

patterns.name: MIn Space
patterns.tooltipTemplate: Lowest percent of the disk space available

targets.expr: avg by (node) ((node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes{node=~"$node"} or (node_memory_MemFree_bytes{node=~"$node"} + node_memory_Buffers_bytes{node=~"$node"} + node_memory_Cached_bytes{node=~"$node"})) / node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{node=~"$node"} * 100)

panels.description: The CPU time is measured in clock ticks or seconds. It is useful to measure CPU time as a percentage of the CPU's capacity, which is called the CPU usage.

targets.expr: clamp_max(((avg by (mode) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode!="idle"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode!="idle"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or (avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node=~"$node", mode!="total", mode!="idle"}[$interval]) or avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node=~"$node", mode!="total", mode!="idle"}[5m]))),100)

clamp_max(avg(rate(container_cpu_system_seconds_total{instance=~"$node",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval])) or 
((avg by () ((clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode="system"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode="system"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or 
(avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node=~"$node", mode="system"}[$interval]) or 
avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node=~"$node", mode="system"}[5m]))),100)

clamp_max(avg(rate(container_cpu_user_seconds_total{instance=~"$node",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval])) or 
((avg by () ((clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode="user"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode="user"}[5m]),1)) ))*100 or 
(avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node=~"$node", mode="user"}[$interval]) or 
avg_over_time(node_cpu_average{node=~"$node", mode="user"}[5m]))),100)

panels.title: CPU Usage - $node

panels.description: When a system is running with maximum CPU utilization, the transmitting and receiving threads must all share the available CPU. This will cause data to be queued more frequently to cope with the lack of CPU. CPU Saturation may be measured as the length of a wait queue, or the time spent waiting on the queue.

targets.expr:
((sum(avg_over_time(container_processes{instance=~"$node",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]))-1) / avg by () (machine_cpu_cores)) or
avg by () ((avg_over_time(node_procs_running{node=~"$node"}[$interval])-1) / scalar(count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user", node=~"$node"})) or (avg_over_time(node_procs_running{node=~"$node"}[5m])-1) / scalar(count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="user", node=~"$node"})))

clamp_max(sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{instance=~"$node",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]) or rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[5m])) or
max by () (sum  by (cpu) ( (clamp_max(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[$interval]),1)) or (clamp_max(irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{node=~"$node",mode!="idle",mode!="iowait"}[5m]),1)) )),1)

panels.title: CPU Saturation and Max Core Usage - $node

panels.description: Network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network at a given point in time.

targets.expr:
sum(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods/.*"}[$interval]) or 
irate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods/.*"}[5m])) or
sum(rate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{node="$node", device!="lo"}[$interval])) or 
sum(irate(node_network_receive_bytes_total{node="$node", device!="lo"}[5m])) or 
sum(max_over_time(rdsosmetrics_network_rx{node="$node"}[$interval])) or 
sum(max_over_time(rdsosmetrics_network_rx{node="$node"}[5m]))

sum(rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods/.*"}[$interval]) or 
irate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods/.*"}[5m])) or 
sum(rate(node_network_transmit_bytes_total{node="$node", device!="lo"}[$interval])) or 
sum(irate(node_network_transmit_bytes_total{node="$node", device!="lo"}[5m])) or
sum(max_over_time(rdsosmetrics_network_tx{node="$node"}[$interval])) or 
sum(max_over_time(rdsosmetrics_network_tx{node="$node"}[5m]))

panels.title: Network Traffic - $node

panels.description:
Disk I/O includes read or write or input/output operations involving a physical disk. It is the speed with which the data transfer takes place between the hard disk drive and RAM.

Swap Activity is memory management that involves swapping sections of memory to and from physical storage.

targets.expr:
avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) or
avg by () (rate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node="$node"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node="$node"}[5m]) * 1024)

avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) or
avg by () ((rate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node="$node"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node="$node"}[5m]) * 1024))

avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) + 
avg by () (sum(rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]) or irate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*"}[5s]))) or 
avg  by () ((rate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node="$node"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgin{node="$node"}[5m]) * 1024 ) + (rate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node="$node"}[$interval]) * 1024 or irate(node_vmstat_pgpgout{node="$node"}[5m]) * 1024))

avg by () (rate(container_memory_swap{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[$interval]) or 
irate(container_memory_swap{instance="$node",id=~"/kubepods.*",container!~"POD|pmm-client|"}[5s])) or 
avg by () (rate(node_vmstat_pswpout{node="$node"}[$interval]) * 4096 or 
irate(node_vmstat_pswpout{node="$node"}[5m]) * 4096)

panels.title: Disk I/O and Swap Activity - $node
